title: Looking for fonts similar to Untitled
content:
I was wondering if anyone knows of fonts similar to Untitled by Joshua Darden since this one does not appear to be available.

here is an example:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090511185105im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Untitled3_3796.gif)
author: Capnhud

comments.content:
Nice call Chris. It is close.

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
I know I am in my own little world, but its ok. They know me here

Thanks. Also, take a look at [Stag Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20090511185105/http:/vllg.com/Schwartzco/Stag/mudTyper+Weights/) there are differences but the feel is very similar at first glance.

So essentially I would be looking for a clarendon type I see. Good call once again.

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
I know I am in my own little world, but its ok. They know me here

Also Darden’s own [Freight Micro](http://web.archive.org/web/20090511185105/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/garagefonts/freight_micro_black/?sample_text=HEIGHT&sample_size=96&acs_p=1&acs_pt=24&acs=1) for a bit more flavor.

Is there a clarendon type that is similar to the R of stag bold?

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
I know I am in my own little world, but its ok. They know me here

Rather similar ’R’s: ’Serifa’, ’Osiris’.  
_(You might even like ’ [Squareface](http://web.archive.org/web/20090511185105/http:/www.p22.com/lanston/squareface.html)’ or ’Caecilia’, as an alternate.)_

Dav(id)

Osiris does the job well. I could not see all the letters for Squareface, but I think it is because of the browser I am using.

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
I know I am in my own little world, but its ok. They know me here

<cite>(You might even like ’Squareface’ or ’Caecilia’, as an alternate.)</cite>

PMN Caecilia regrettably doesn’t have a bold enough bold or (even) a black. Wish it had, it’s my favorite humanistic slab.

. . .  
Bert Vanderveen BNO
Out of curiousity, does anyone know the story of why Untitled is no more?
